newsitem.title: UK: SOCCER-ARSENAL SIGN AUSTRIAN GOALKEEPER MANNINGER.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-ARSENAL SIGN AUSTRIAN GOALKEEPER MANNINGER.

text.p: English giants Arsenal signed Austria under-21 goalkeeper Alexander Manninger from Casino Graz on Tuesday for an undisclosed fee.
Manninger will become the first Austrian to join an English premier league side when he leaves Graz at the end of this season.
"We signed him this afternoon and he'll be joining us in the summer," an Arsenal spokeswoman said. She declined to give details of the fee involved or the length of contract.
Austrian news agency APA said the 19-year-old had agreed to a six-year deal and Graz manager Peter Svetits said: "All I can say is that it is the largest sum ever paid for an Austrian player."
"We just have to agree on a few minor details of the contract," he said.
Graz are reported to have wanted around $1.0 million for Manninger, who was under contract with them until 2001.
He signed for Arsenal after impressing manager Arsene Wenger in a two-day trial at Highbury this week.
Arsenal's first-choice goalkeeper David Seaman is recovering from a knee operation and his deputy John Lukic is sidelined with a poisoned toe.
Both men could be nearing the end of their careers. Seaman is 33 and Lukic is 35.
Manninger became Graz's number one goalkeeper last October after a brilliant performance in the San Siro stadium in his first European match -- a UEFA Cup tie against Italy's Internazionale.
